title: HTP204A_WBC
extract_protocol_ch1.1: Strand-specific libraries were prepared by Novogene
data_processing: FASTQC (v0.11.5) was used to assess sequence data quality
data_processing.1: Low quality bases (Q <10) were trimmed from the 3' end of reads and short reads (<30 nt after trimming) and adaptor sequences were removed using the fastqc-mcf(v1.05) tool from ea-utils
data_processing.2: FastQ Screen (v0.9.1) was used to check for common sequencing contaminants
data_processing.3: Alignment to the Human reference genome (GRCh37/hg19) was carried out using TopHat2 (v2.1.1, --b2-sensitive --keep-fasta-order --no-coverage-search --max-multihits 10 --library-type fr-firststrand) with the UCSC hg19 GTF annotation file provided in the iGenomes UCSC hg19 bundle (https://support.illumina.com/sequencing/sequencing_software/igenome.html)
data_processing.4: Aligned reads were then filtered to remove low quality mapped reads (MAPQ < 10) using SAMtools (v1.5)
data_processing.5: Reads were coordinate sorted and duplicates were marked using Picard (v2.9.4)
data_processing.6: Quality assessment of final mapped reads was performed using RSeQC (v2.6.4)
data_processing.7: Raw gene-level count data was generated using HTSeq (v0.8.0) with the following options (--stranded=reverse –minaqual=10 –type=exon –idattr=gene_id --mode=intersection-nonempty) using the GTF provided in the UCSC hg19-based igenomes bundle (https://support.illumina.com/sequencing/sequencing_software/igenome.html)
data_processing.8: Genome_build: GRCh37/hg19; Bowtie2 index and GTF from iGenomes UCSC hg19 bundle (https://support.illumina.com/sequencing/sequencing_software/igenome.html)
data_processing.9: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Tab delimited text files containing raw gene-level counts and RPKM for each sample
contact_department: Pharmacology & Linda Crnic Institute for Down Syndrome
contact_institute: University of Colorado Anschutz Medical Campus
contact_address: RC1-N, Mail Stop 8303, Rm. P18-6114 12800 E. 19th Ave.

data_processing.1: Low quality bases (Q <10) were trimmed from the 3' end of reads and short reads (<30 nt after trimming) and adaptor sequences were removed using the fastqc-mcf(v1.05) tool from ea-utils
data_processing.2: FastQ Screen (v0.9.1) was used to check for common sequencing contaminants
data_processing.3: Alignment to the Human reference genome (GRCh37/hg19) was carried out using TopHat2 (v2.1.1, --b2-sensitive --keep-fasta-order --no-coverage-search --max-multihits 10 --library-type fr-firststrand) with the UCSC hg19 GTF annotation file provided in the iGenomes UCSC hg19 bundle (https://support.illumina.com/sequencing/sequencing_software/igenome.html)
data_processing.4: Aligned reads were then filtered to remove low quality mapped reads (MAPQ < 10) using SAMtools (v1.5)
data_processing.5: Reads were coordinate sorted and duplicates were marked using Picard (v2.9.4)
data_processing.6: Quality assessment of final mapped reads was performed using RSeQC (v2.6.4)
data_processing.7: Raw gene-level count data was generated using HTSeq (v0.8.0) with the following options (--stranded=reverse –minaqual=10 –type=exon –idattr=gene_id --mode=intersection-nonempty) using the GTF provided in the UCSC hg19-based igenomes bundle (https://support.illumina.com/sequencing/sequencing_software/igenome.html)
data_processing.8: Genome_build: GRCh37/hg19; Bowtie2 index and GTF from iGenomes UCSC hg19 bundle (https://support.illumina.com/sequencing/sequencing_software/igenome.html)
data_processing.9: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: Tab delimited text files containing raw gene-level counts and RPKM for each sample
